image.altText: Max and berts burnt

props.synopsis: For three years, the ACT government has been claiming to be rebuilding two heritage huts destroyed by fire. When the ABC started asking questions, the story changed.

title.children: 'Like a gravestone': The heritage huts that won't rise again

image.altText: A man with short brown hair wearing a red and blue checkered shirt stands in front of a courthouse looking serious.

props.synopsis: The ACT Supreme Court hears a harrowing account from a child sex abuse survivor in which his life has been "shattered", with the trauma made worse by a years-long delay in having his case heard.

title.children: Child sex abuse survivor calls for urgent case management reform

image.altText: A woman wearing a denim jacket sitting at a desk with a microphone.

props.synopsis: Former member of the Australian National University council Liz Allen has used a Senate inquiry investigating university governance to allege Chancellor Julie Bishop harassed, bullied, and threatened her.

title.children: Julie Bishop accused of bullying by ANU staff member, senate inquiry hears

image.altText: The exterior of a red brick building with the word "Emergency" written above an awning over the building's entrance.

props.synopsis: A record number of patients have visited Canberra's emergency rooms this winter, with expected wait times pushing above nine hours at Canberra Hospital last night.

title.children: Canberra Hospital sets new daily record of ED presentations

image.altText: A sign on the Barton Highway

props.synopsis: The 78-year-old driver of a car has died after his vehicle collided with a truck on the Barton Highway in southern New South Wales this afternoon.

title.children: Man dies, highway closed after truck and car collision

image.altText: An older couple stands outside their suburban home and smiles.

props.synopsis: Transport Minister Chris Steel has written to the toll operator asking it to provide refunds to affected ACT motorists who were issued with toll notices for trips they did not take, due to similarities between licence plates.

title.children: Canberra drivers wrongly charged for trips on Sydney toll roads

image.altText: The ACT Supreme Court towards dusk.

props.synopsis: Hermes handbags, multiple properties, cash and a Rolex watch receipt for $24,000, are alleged to be part of the "unexplained wealth" of a Chinese national charged with reckless foreign interference in Canberra last week.

title.children: Court hears woman accused of foreign interference has 'unexplained wealth'

image.altText: A long, thin indoor pool with a ramp into the water.

props.synopsis: After a five-year wait, a new hydrotherapy pool is ready to open in Canberra's south, and while it's being welcomed by those living with chronic health conditions, concerns remain that it won't be enough to meet demand.

title.children: 'A long day coming': New hydrotherapy pool set to open in Tuggeranong

image.altText: A large billboard with Russian writing on it is seen near a local road on an overcast day.

props.synopsis: You don't have to look far in Russia to find hypotheses as to why Alaska is in the wrong hands. Whether Moscow could ever rule it again depends on who you talk to.

title.children: To understand Russia's 'Alaska myth', there's a song that could help

image.altText: Kitchen worker uses tongs in a pub kitchen in Sydney.

props.synopsis: The peak union group says a shorter work week would improve productivity and reduce burnout, adding workers should also be able to share in the spoils of the expected artificial intelligence boom.

title.children: Peak union group says it's time for a shorter work week

image.altText: A crowd of people surround a truck, some are climbing on the truck.

props.synopsis: A joint statement, signed by Foreign Minister Penny Wong, condemns the politicisation of aid and says "urgent action is needed now to halt and reverse starvation" in Gaza.

title.children: Australia and allies say Gaza's aid crisis has reached 'unimaginable levels'

image.altText: James Crisp x

props.synopsis: A father and son were accused of preying on victims at a Catholic boarding school but only one was charged.  Now they are both behind bars.

title.children: Father and son jailed decades after role in alleged school paedophile ring

image.altText: An image of a man with glasses and grey hair inset against an emergency department sign and a hospital building.

props.synopsis: A coroner rules a dementia patient who disappeared from a regional Queensland hospital in 2023, never to be seen again, died from dehydration. It prompted security changes, but did not stop similar incidents.

title.children: Dementia patient walks out of hospital never to be seen again

image.altText: A man poses in a photo.

props.synopsis: A man was set to receive $12,000 for directing an arson attack on a Jewish business in Sydney's east last year, court documents allege.

title.children: Court documents allege $12k payment for arson attack in Jewish business

image.altText: A close up photo of Donald Trump. He his tilting his head and looking ahead with a slight frown.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump has announced a federal takeover of Washington DC's police force, saying the city is "becoming a situation of complete and total lawlessness". But is this true?

title.children: Trump says he must 'rescue' Washington DC from crime. How bad is it?

image.altText: A woman wearing a teal headdress is crying with tears rolling from her eyes

props.synopsis: The Independent Investigative Mechanism for Myanmar said victims were subject to beatings, electric shocks, sexual violence, strangulation and other forms of torture.

title.children: UN-backed investigator alleges torture in Myanmar detention facilities

image.altText: A woman wearing a denim jacket sitting at a desk with a microphone.

props.synopsis: Former member of the Australian National University council Liz Allen has used a Senate inquiry investigating university governance to allege Chancellor Julie Bishop harassed, bullied, and threatened her.

title.children: Julie Bishop accused of bullying by ANU staff member, senate inquiry hears

image.altText: A blue tent that says "SES" stands out the front of a cream house sprayed with black and lime green graffiti.

props.synopsis: A man has been charged with two counts of murder after police found two bodies in a unit in Melbourne's south-east on Monday night.

title.children: Man charged over deaths of man and woman in Mount Waverley

image.altText: A black greyhound looks at the camera

props.synopsis: The announcement of funding being ended for Tasmania's greyhound racing industry has left the people who work in it "filthy, angry", a trainer says — with special mention made of the Liberal state premier.

title.children: Greyhound racing a 'scapegoat' in political power tussle, trainer says

image.altText: GettyImages-97340442

props.synopsis: It was a season that would go down in history as one of the great AFL performances. Now, the five men who played for the Blues for the first time in 1995 tell their stories of that incredible year.

title.children: How five debuts help tell the story of Carlton's remarkable 1995 season

image.altText: A sandstone cliff line landslide with rocks at the bottom.

props.synopsis: One of the largest Blue Mountains rockfalls in recent years shaves off two notorious climbing routes that were never repeated after the first climbers established them.

title.children: Giant landslide triggers memory of climber cooking cliff-side steaks

image.altText: A dog toy that looks like a monkey and a red ball in the foreground of a dog house outside. It feels moody.

props.synopsis: Victim-survivors of domestic violence say the bond they share with their pets is weaponised as a form of coercive control, as legal experts push for animal abuse to be recognised under the law.

title.children: DV prevention advocates want animal abuse defined in SA's coercive control laws

image.altText: A pharmacist speaks to a patient in a small room.

props.synopsis: The peak national body for community pharmacists wants to its members take on more responsibilities for community care in an 'ambitious' plan, but the initiative also has its critics.

title.children: Pharmacy guild plan to expand role to diagnose and treat conditions

image.altText: Dean Winter, Rosalie Woodruff composite image.

props.synopsis: Like in the AFL, Tasmanian politics is in its own trade week — and at the moment, the protracted negotiations are between Labor and the Greens.

title.children: Tasmanian Greens unwilling to give Labor blank cheque as deals go down to the wire

image.altText: People walking past the outside of the Reserve Bank of Australia in Sydney.

props.synopsis: The central bank delivers its third interest rate cut of the year after last month's unexpected decision to hold, taking the cash rate to 3.6 per cent for the first time since April 2023.

title.children: Interest rates fall in unanimous decision by RBA board

image.altText: A Fortnite character is seen against a blue background surrounded by the logos for Apple and Google

props.synopsis: The federal court has today ruled against tech giants Apple and Google in a major win for consumers, finding that the companies engaged in anti-competitive conduct.

title.children: Apple and Google lose landmark court case over anti-competitive conduct

image.altText: A court sketch of a man looking off to the side.

props.synopsis: The helicopter pilot involved in the crash that killed Chris "Willow" Wilson tells the Northern Territory Supreme Court that he "intentionally disconnected" Netflix star Matt Wright before Mr Wilson fell 25 metres to his death.

title.children: Pilot shares frustrations over crash that took his ability to walk

image.altText: A photo of a police officer in official uniform, standing in an outback landscape as the sun sets behind him.

props.synopsis: A doctor who treated a constable that later took his own life defends his treatment plan to a coronial inquest, while describing him as a "gentle, beautiful man".

title.children: GP blames 'rotten' police culture for constable's death

image.altText: Erin Patterson looks at the camera as she sits in the back of a prison van

props.synopsis: A Victorian judge says prosecutors were seeking to use "dubious" arguments to convict Erin Patterson of poisoning her husband before the Crown abandoned its case.

title.children: Dropped Erin Patterson poisoning charges were 'dubious', judge says

image.altText: Anthony Albanese stands next to Penny Wong.

props.synopsis: The comment came a day after Benjamin Netanyahu rebuked Australia's move to join France, the United Kingdom, and Canada in recognising Palestinian statehood.

title.children: Albanese takes swipe at 'in denial' Israeli prime minister

image.altText: an elegant  woman with short, grey hair wearing a green shirt and smart jacket.

props.synopsis: Greens leader Rosalie Woodruff announces the party cannot back Tasmanian Labor's bid to form minority government "at this stage" — with Labor's Dean Winter warning of job cuts under the "Abetz, Rockliff" Liberals.

title.children: Greens withhold support for Labor's bid for Tasmanian government 'at this stage'

image.altText: a composite image of Alex Greenwich and Mark Latham

props.synopsis: In a case before the NSW Civil and Administrative Tribunal, MP Alex Greenwich alleges four public statements by the former One Nation state leader constituted unlawful homosexual vilification and sexual harassment in the workplace.

title.children: Sydney MP tells tribunal Latham has 'abusive obsession' with him

image.altText: A man in a white shirt speaks to a camera

props.synopsis: Australian taxpayers have spent around half a billion dollars to fund the expansion of Papua New Guinea's Lombrum naval base — well over double the $175 million price tag originally flagged by the federal government.

title.children: $500m naval base expansion Australia's 'biggest infrastructure project' in the Pacific

image.altText: A police officer with their head and face covered holds a gun beside a plain clothes officer outside a house with police tape.

props.synopsis: Heavily armed police found the bodies of a man and woman inside a house that was covered in graffiti in Melbourne's south-east.

title.children: Man arrested at railway station after two found dead in Mount Waverley

image.altText: An illustration of a young boy staring at a computer. He is surrounded by text bubbles.

props.synopsis: An investigation by triple j hack uncovers allegations of young people in Australia being sexually harassed and even encouraged to take their own life by AI chatbots.

title.children: Young Australian hospitalised after ChatGPT use
